isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - SHIFT CONTROL LINKAGE ADJUSTMENT PROCEDURE WITH MANUAL TRANSMISSION - SERVICE PROCEDURES - REMOTE CONTROL TOWER

svcprocinfo.para: Procedures for servicing the remote control tower assembly differ somewhat between transmission models. The steps outlined below are presented as general guidelines for control tower service.

step1.para: Remove the cotter pin and castellated nut, then disconnect the control rod/ selection lever from the remote control outer shift lever (Item 12, Figure 1). If necessary, tap the end of the stud with a soft hammer or drift to loosen the tapered stud from the lever.
If the pivot rod is to be serviced, remove the cotter pin and castellated nut (Item 3, Figure 17). Disconnect the pivot rod assembly from the control rod/selection lever.
Remove the remaining control tower retaining bolts or nuts and remove the control assembly from the transmission housing.
Cover the opening in the transmission housing to prevent the entry of foreign material.

svcsubproc.title: Inspection
svcsubproc.para: Inspect the control assembly and replace any worn or broken parts ( Figure 18).

figure.caption: Figure 18. Exploded View of the Remote Control Tower Assembly

step1.para: Make sure the poppet springs are in position in the transmission housing ( Figure 19).

figure.caption: Figure 19. Remote Control Mounting Surface on the Transmission Housing

step1.para: Align the transmission shift forks in a NEUTRAL position.
Install a new gasket on the transmission housing.

note.para: Gasket design varies between transmission models. Fuller transmissions use a gasket/baffle having a small opening for the shift lever near the center of the gasket. Be sure to use the correct gasket for the transmission being serviced.

step1.para: Position the remote control tower assembly on the transmission housing. Make sure the remote control inner shift lever enters the slots in the shift forks.
Install the remote control tower mounting bolts or nuts.
Position the pivot rod bracket on the remote control lever and install the mounting bolts or nuts.

Tighten the remote control lever and pivot rod bracket mounting bolts and/or nuts as specified in the TORQUE CHART
.

Connect the selection lever (control rod) to the remote control outer shift lever. Tighten the castle nut as specified in the TORQUE CHART
. If the cotter pin slots do not align with the hole in the stud, continue to tighten until aligned and install the cotter pin.
If the pivot rod was removed, connect the pivot rod to the remote control housing and selection lever (control rod). Install the castle nuts as instructed in Step 8.

Check the shift linkage adjustment as instructed in ADJUSTMENT PROCEDURE
. Readjust if required.
